channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- wp-affiliate-platform
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- wp-affiliate-platform

item.title: CVE-2024-5282|2024-07-13T06:00:10.553Z -- unknown -- wp-affiliate-platform
item.description: The wp-affiliate-platform WordPress plugin before 6.5.1 does not sanitise and escape a parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin

item.title: CVE-2024-5284|2024-07-13T06:00:10.957Z -- unknown -- wp-affiliate-platform
item.description: The wp-affiliate-platform WordPress plugin before 6.5.1 does not have CSRF check in some places, and is missing sanitisation as well as escaping, which could allow attackers to make logged in admin add Stored XSS payloads via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-5280|2024-07-13T06:00:10.160Z -- unknown -- wp-affiliate-platform
item.description: The wp-affiliate-platform WordPress plugin before 6.5.1 does not have CSRF check in some places, and is missing sanitisation as well as escaping, which could allow attackers to make non-logged in users execute an XSS payload via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-5283|2024-07-13T06:00:10.758Z -- unknown -- wp-affiliate-platform
item.description: The wp-affiliate-platform WordPress plugin before 6.5.1 does not sanitise and escape a parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin

item.title: CVE-2024-5287|2024-07-13T06:00:11.336Z -- unknown -- wp-affiliate-platform
item.description: The wp-affiliate-platform WordPress plugin before 6.5.1 does not have CSRF check in place when updating its settings, which could allow attackers to make a logged in user change them via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-5281|2024-07-13T06:00:10.359Z -- unknown -- wp-affiliate-platform
item.description: The wp-affiliate-platform WordPress plugin before 6.5.1 does not sanitise and escape a parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin

item.title: CVE-2024-5286|2024-07-13T06:00:11.139Z -- unknown -- wp-affiliate-platform
item.description: The wp-affiliate-platform WordPress plugin before 6.5.1 does not sanitise and escape a parameter before outputting it back in the page, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin
